content.description: Hard, bouldery start to easier but engaging climbing that passes through a short dihedral. Finish over the roof. Despite not getting any stars in the guidebook, I thought this one was pretty fun.
content.protection: 10 glue-in protection bolts (the upper two have chain to extend around the roof). Two anchor bolts with mussy hooks.
content.location: Middle section of the Theater, down and left around the corner from Protest Too Much.

climbs.name: To Boo, or Not to Boo

content.description: Climb on great calcite features with mostly moderate climbing with a brief crux toward the top.
content.protection: 10 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with mussy hooks.
content.location: 2nd route from the right. Climbs the face immediately right of the large crack on Midsummer Night's Seam.

content.description: Fun climbing on cool calcite features as you ascend over bulges.
content.protection: 10 bolts plus 2 bolt anchor with mussy hooks.
content.location: Taming of the Boo is the rightmost route at the Theater and is the first route you come to when coming up the trail.

content.description: Climb up the left side of the face with technical and powerful moves.
content.location: Two hangers left of 'Midsummer Night's Seam' (the crack).

content.description: Slab start to some fun moves in the middle and a powerful boulder problem crux getting over the bulge up high.
content.location: Bolted route just right of Protest Too Much and just left of the wide crack Midsummer Night's Seam.

content.description: Big, wide crack that you don't really need to jam at all as the edge of the crack and face features allow you to layback the shit out of it. Swing over and toprope it from To Boo, or Not to Boo if you didn't lug the big gear up the approach.
content.protection: Standard rack with emphasis on wide gear. 2 bolt anchor at top.
content.location: The obvious wide corner crack to the left of To Boo, or Not to Boo.

content.description: Climb up a few easy moves sharing a bolt with "What's in a Name", then move right to the arete with a trickier move up high.
content.location: Begins at the break in the wall to the right of "An Overflow of Good". Look for the Petzl long life bolts with the weird machine washers.

content.description:
Start up the crack just right of All the World's a Stage then trend up and right following bolts through steep terrain on okay holds. Lower angle, easier finish.

This one was still pretty sandy when I climbed it last spring. Do your part and take a lap to clean it up! Unlike most routes at the Theater, this felt pretty full value for the rating (partly due to the sand).
content.protection: 8 bolts plus anchor. Optional hand-size cam at the bottom (or stick clip), and another optional (nice) #3 cam placement near the top.
content.location: Just right of All the World's a Stage, left side of the Theater.

content.description: Start at the base of Life Is A Banquet and traverse immediately right. Interesting face climbing leads to a steep move near the top with a couple more bolts above.
content.location: In the middle of the wall just right of the arete of Life Is a Banquet. Look for the overhang.

content.description: Excellent route. Start on the right side of the orange face and wander some as you follow the chalk and the line of least resistance. A stretchy reach to the left at about 1/3 height is the technical crux of the route. Climb on mostly moderate terrain to the base of the roof, then load up and fire through the roof on huge holds and gun it to the anchor.
content.protection: 12 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with mussy hooks.
content.location: Around the corner to the east of Midsummer Night's Seam are where the longer routes lie. An Overflow of Good climbs a light orange face with a roof up high that faces north, or more directly to the river. Look for the "11" drawn in chalk at the start. It's the next route left of a collection of 3 5.10 and 5.11 routes that climb the dark rock on a more east facing wall with a ledge at the base.

content.description:
New route in Spring of 2019, bottom 20 feet is flaky and deserves your attention.  Consider stick clipping the 2nd bolt or clipping it after you climb To Boo or Not to Boo.  The bottom section is cleaning up nicely with more traffic.

Adds another 5.10 pitch in this zone.
content.protection: 10 glue-in bolts plus a two-bolt anchor equipped with lowering carabiners.
content.location:
This route sits between To Boo and The Taming of the Boo.  Funky and flaky climbing past the first 4 bolts gets you to more enjoyable movement.

Crux involves some traversing moves about 50’ up.

climbs.name: All the World's a Stage
climbs.fa: Sam Lightner Jr. and Liz Lightner

content.description: Broken rock at the start leads to cranking on large, sandy pockets.  Criss-cross back and forth around the arete to work your way up.
content.location: Start at the stairs going up the scree cone.
